content:
Just got this puzzle and I guess it's almost unsolvable in the "reverse" mode even with stub code hint.

Previous comments only mention  "quick" and "shortest" modes, and current game modes consist only of "reverse" - it looks rather strange. Is this change intentional?

Nice challenge, but I think you should add another test/validator pair. The only one that currently has any digits in it is "De Finibus Bonorum Et Malorum". In Shortest mode it would be tempted to use Regexp "\w" to replace the letters but this will fail on that test case because it matches the "3"s. It's best to have a test case that has digits or underscores too, so that clashers don't get 100% on tests and then 75% on validators.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: An enjoyable puzzle

* Please standardise use of "code", "uncode", "decypher" - I suggest "encoded"/"decoded".

* space is not "ignored", since it still appears in the decoded message - it just isn't altered.

* "The goal is to output the most frequent word in the original message" is ambiguous. "Original" could be understood as the message the player received, before they messed around decoding it. 
Suggest: "The goal is to find the most frequently used word in the decoded message".

* Output: I suggest "The most frequently used word in the decoded message, in lower case"

Very good puzzle though - I look forward to approving it.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Contribution is really interesting, and is a great exercise for both quick and short code clashes.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: description is clear and good exercise for high level clashers
i think you should clarify more on description how you ended up with 'you' as an answer. your description is only up to deciphering part. its good clash btw

‚ùå Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Unclear

I feel that the people who reject the clash simply because the author has rejected theirs ( https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/80403ac8a25c35aeb9d26d1b6bf8549629b3f ). If this clash gets unfortunately rejected, the author should resubmit it.

Goal
* Please format "t" as a {{constant}} in "o+5=t".

* Please fix the typo: "wich" => "which".

* Suggest to change "the only one appearing as often" to "unique".

Thanks.

‚ùå Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Unclear
I guess such a cypher has a name, so if anyone know it, I'd happily have you tell me so that I can write it in the statement.

Well I'm not sure, I don't have rejected a lot of contribution in the past, maybe I did I don't remembe. But I resubmit anyway when I have more upvotes than downvotes so don't worry about it it is not big deal.
The problem is more than "unclear" is not really clear, what's unclear ?
It is written, the word the most present in the decyphered message, it is you in the example
Well I guess you're right so I've done that but I don't think 'ignored' was ambiguous, I didn't say removed.
Oh right, I copied the text from wikipedia and it seems I forgot to delete the references numbers. I'll rather delete them. Thanks

Fixed. I did it a year ago and it has been a while since I last got on CodinGame but I don't recall changing that. I think anyone can change any CoC but I'm not sure anymore. It is indeed intended to be Fastest or Shortest
Ok, cool. Then that's better. :)

I don't really remember what was the sentence, but i think it was something like, "If you were to ever read that message decyphered you would be able to see that the most frequent word is you, in fact you have read 'you' five times already." The sentence in itself tells you why 'you'

you can add this as the deciphered sentence. then thats how you ended up with 'you' as the answer. im just saying u just need to complete the example in the description so its comprehensive to clashers
Yeah I think I get it, but I believe it is impossible to change the example box, so I just wrote it in the statement, does it seems good to you ?
it is more understandable now :) clashers need clarity to especially on fastest mode
